[The frontend
cloud](https://vercel.com/resources/successful-frontend-cloud-adoption-implementation-roi){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}
allows your developers to utilize best-of-breed tools to build great web
experiences. You can clean up your workflow, iterate faster, and achieve
world-class performance with Vercel to deliver more value to users.
Companies like
[Loom](https://vercel.com/blog/loom-headless-with-nextjs){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}, The
Washington Post, and cal.com have told us they're shipping faster than
ever before---and their users are noticing the excellent experiences
they're building.

> Deploying our Next.js sites onto Vercel is so helpful because I can
> test what my site will look like in production and solicit feedback
> through comments from my team every step of the way. I can know at a
> specific moment in time: \"what did that UI look like?\" And when
> you\'re debugging, I can have a link from a month ago, two weeks ago.
> That is such a valuable tool to have at my disposal.

## []{#forward-thinking-companies-are-adopting-next.js .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Forward thinking companies are adopting Next.js](#forward-thinking-companies-are-adopting-next.js){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#forward-thinking-companies-are-adopting-next.js .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

The frontend cloud has become the industry standard for the fastest way
to build stable software for high-velocity frontend teams. And, every
day, we help developers with migrations from legacy systems (including
some of the past decade's most popular frontend technologies) to
Next.js.

::: geist-hide-on-dark

Vercel and Next.js are built to work headlessly with your existing data
sources while you build an amazing frontend, ensuring you can leverage
what already makes your business great while improving on the
presentation of your core content.

In this e-book, we'll take a look at key things to look forward to while
you're migrating, strategies for making the move, and ways to manage
risk while you're working on your migration.

## []{#benefits-of-your-new-frontend-toolkit .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Benefits of your new frontend toolkit](#benefits-of-your-new-frontend-toolkit){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#benefits-of-your-new-frontend-toolkit .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

Vercel's best-in-class frontend cloud is equipped with the essentials
for improving iteration velocity. To get the most out of your adoption,
it's important to understand why you're making this choice and the
advantages you'll find.

- **Security:** Build with security as a default. [Vercel Secure
  Compute](https://vercel.com/docs/security/secure-compute){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}
  dedicates an IP address to your Vercel workloads and Vercel Firewall
  allows you to quickly block IP addresses for extra power on top of
  Vercel\'s automatic DDoS migitation.
- **Functions:**
  [Serverless](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/serverless-functions){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"} and
  [Edge
  Functions](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/edge-functions){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"} let
  you decrease cost, improve uptime, and provide instant auto-scaling to
  your frontend. When you deploy Next.js ([or any of our 40+ supported
  frameworks](https://vercel.com/docs/frameworks#list-of-supported-frameworks){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}) on
  Vercel, your developers will enjoy a completely seamless experience,
  finding the same behavior of Next.js on their local machines when
  compared to their preview and production deployments.
- **Caching:** Next.js on Vercel automatically combines the best that
  Next.js has to offer with the benefits of serverless architectures.
  Through [Framework Defined
  Infrastructure](https://vercel.com/blog/framework-defined-infrastructure){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"},
  developers are able to configure caching behavior more easily than
  ever before, including the latest innovations in frontend caching like
  Incremental Static Regeneration.
- **Observability:** First-party, built-in tooling to gain insights
  about what's going on in your frontend cloud. Query, visualize, and
  quantify the traffic to your Vercel project to find opportunities to
  optimize bandwidth, errors, and performance with [Monitoring and
  Logging](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/observability){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

## []{#strategies-for-incremental-adoption .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Strategies for incremental adoption](#strategies-for-incremental-adoption){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#strategies-for-incremental-adoption .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

To manage the risks associated with any software migration, it's a great
idea to make small, reversible changes to your system over time so [you
can quickly roll back to previous, working
versions](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/deployments/instant-rollback){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"} in
case something goes wrong. We encourage you to adopt the frontend cloud
slowly, ensuring that your confidence stays high no matter what phase of
adoption you are at.

To achieve this, we\'ll create a plan to run a combination of your
current system alongside your new Vercel frontend to get started. When
you begin, you may only have a few pages being served by Vercel, slowly
adding to your new Next.js application over time.

As we've worked with our customers over the years, we've found two
common strategies for incremental adoption.

### []{#point-your-domain-at-vercel-with-your-existing-server-as-a-fallback .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Point your domain at Vercel with your existing server as a fallback](#point-your-domain-at-vercel-with-your-existing-server-as-a-fallback){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#point-your-domain-at-vercel-with-your-existing-server-as-a-fallback .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

One approach is to make Vercel the initial entrypoint for your domain.
For application paths that have been built in your Next.js application,
Vercel will serve your newly crafted page. When a path is requested that
hasn't been built in your new application yet, your application will
seamlessly fallback to your existing server and serve a response from
there.

:::::::: {.text-block_codeWrapper__HzDMh vercel-edit-target="true"}
::::::: {.relative .code-block_wrapper__t6FCO .code-block_hasFileName__ezlBD geist-code-block=""}
:::::: code-block_header__t3NRd
:::: code-block_fileName__HmSv1
::: {.code-block_iconWrapper__TuHFk aria-hidden="true"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

[next.config.js]{.code-block_filenameP__02nok}
::::

::: code-block_actions__yphRf
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::
::::::

``` {.prism-code .language-javascript .code-block_pre___OLfy}
module.exports = {  async rewrites() {    return {      fallback: [        {          source: '/:path*',          destination: `https://my-old-site.com/:path*`,        },      ],    }  },};
```
:::::::

Setting fallback paths for any route not available in our application.
::::::::

With these rewrites in place, the original request's path, headers, and
cookies will be preserved and passed on to your existing server
solution. If you want to configure rewrites at a more granular level,
[check out the Next.js documentation on
rewrites](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/next-config-js/rewrites){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

### []{#specify-a-subpath-for-your-vercel-application .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Specify a subpath for your Vercel application](#specify-a-subpath-for-your-vercel-application){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#specify-a-subpath-for-your-vercel-application .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

As another option, you can choose to continue using your existing
resources as the main entrypoint to your application and use Vercel on a
subpath within your larger application setup.

Depending on your current system, you may need to configure a rewrite or
reverse proxy to point at Vercel. With that in place, we will need to
make sure we tell Next.js about this routing context.

Luckily, this is easy to do using [the `basePath`{.code_code__FwiyS
style="font-size:0.9em"} property in your
`next.config.js`{.code_code__FwiyS style="font-size:0.9em"}
file](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/next-config-js/basePath){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

:::::::: {.text-block_codeWrapper__HzDMh vercel-edit-target="true"}
::::::: {.relative .code-block_wrapper__t6FCO .code-block_hasFileName__ezlBD geist-code-block=""}
:::::: code-block_header__t3NRd
:::: code-block_fileName__HmSv1
::: {.code-block_iconWrapper__TuHFk aria-hidden="true"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

[next.config.js]{.code-block_filenameP__02nok}
::::

::: code-block_actions__yphRf
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::
::::::

``` {.prism-code .language-javascript .code-block_pre___OLfy}
module.exports = {  basePath: '/docs',};
```
:::::::

Setting a base path for the entire Next.js application.
::::::::

With this flag set, Next.js will be able to properly route it's requests
as a sub-path of your domain.

## []{#manage-risk-while-you're-adopting-vercel .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Manage risk while you\'re adopting Vercel](#manage-risk-while-you're-adopting-vercel){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#manage-risk-while-youre-adopting-vercel .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

You've done your homework, carefully crafted a plan, and you\'re ready
to start using Vercel\'s workflow tooling. Our tools are built to give
you confidence but, to be fully prepared for a production migration, we
need to be responsible engineers and ensure we are safely rolling out
your new technology with \"escape hatches\" for if something unexpected
happens.

### []{#using-next.js-middleware-and-vercel-edge-config .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Using Next.js Middleware and Vercel Edge Config](#using-next.js-middleware-and-vercel-edge-config){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#using-next.js-middleware-and-vercel-edge-config .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

The first strategy we recommend is to use Vercel Edge Config. With this
tool, we'll add a zero latency flag, passing all requests back to your
original server. Depending on the complexity you desire, you can build a
flexible routing architecture based on this approach through the power
of [Vercel Edge
Middleware](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/edge-middleware){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

:::::::: {.text-block_codeWrapper__HzDMh vercel-edit-target="true"}
::::::: {.relative .code-block_wrapper__t6FCO .code-block_hasFileName__ezlBD geist-code-block=""}
:::::: code-block_header__t3NRd
:::: code-block_fileName__HmSv1
::: {.code-block_iconWrapper__TuHFk aria-hidden="true"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

[middleware.ts]{.code-block_filenameP__02nok}
::::

::: code-block_actions__yphRf
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::
::::::

``` {.prism-code .language-tsx .code-block_pre___OLfy}
import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server'import { get } from '@vercel/edge-config'
export const config = {  matcher: ['/:path*'], // URL to match}
export async function middleware(req: NextRequest) {  try {    // Check whether new version should should be shown    const isNewVersionActive = await get<boolean>('isNewVersionActive')
    // If is in the new version not active we rewrite to the legacy server URL    if (!isNewVersionActive) {      req.nextUrl.pathname = `/new-path`       return NextResponse.rewrite(req.nextUrl)    }  } catch (error) {    console.error(error)  }}
```
:::::::

Using a flag to create a safety switch for the new application.
::::::::

We find that companies adopting Vercel only want to keep this flag
option around through the first few steps of their migration. Once teams
begin working in the frontend cloud, they develop confidence and new
levels of productivity quickly through the stability of their new
system. Additionally, you\'ll notice new levels of communication and
feedback, and how your new performance gains move your business metrics
since [milliseconds make
millions](https://web.dev/milliseconds-make-millions/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

### []{#using-cookies-to-serve-specific-pages-from-vercel .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Using cookies to serve specific pages from Vercel](#using-cookies-to-serve-specific-pages-from-vercel){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#using-cookies-to-serve-specific-pages-from-vercel .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Another strategy is to use use cookies to redirect traffic from your
servers to a Vercel-hosted page. This strategy is great for
incrementally introducing traffic to your Vercel application, letting
you do percentage-based and canary-based rollouts.

Depending on your current setup, the implementation for this approach
can vary in complexity. You\'ll be trading that complexity for more
granular control over how traffic is being routed for your application
and we typically only recommend this approach for customers with
high-risk requirements.

you can breathe new life into your teams' projects.

We'll help you to build trust in your frontend cloud while continually,
incrementally ensuring you deliver more value to your users. If you
haven't already, [get in touch with one of our experts
today](https://www.notion.so/How-We-Started-Our-Rust-Porting-Effort-9897e09ab42549d28657d91956b87cce?pvs=21){.link_link__hbWKh

begin your frontend cloud journey.

## []{#forward-thinking-companies-are-adopting-next.js .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Forward thinking companies are adopting Next.js](#forward-thinking-companies-are-adopting-next.js){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#forward-thinking-companies-are-adopting-next.js .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

The frontend cloud has become the industry standard for the fastest way
to build stable software for high-velocity frontend teams. And, every
day, we help developers with migrations from legacy systems (including
some of the past decade's most popular frontend technologies) to
Next.js.

::: geist-hide-on-dark

Vercel and Next.js are built to work headlessly with your existing data
sources while you build an amazing frontend, ensuring you can leverage
what already makes your business great while improving on the
presentation of your core content.

In this e-book, we'll take a look at key things to look forward to while
you're migrating, strategies for making the move, and ways to manage
risk while you're working on your migration.

## []{#benefits-of-your-new-frontend-toolkit .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Benefits of your new frontend toolkit](#benefits-of-your-new-frontend-toolkit){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#benefits-of-your-new-frontend-toolkit .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

Vercel's best-in-class frontend cloud is equipped with the essentials
for improving iteration velocity. To get the most out of your adoption,
it's important to understand why you're making this choice and the
advantages you'll find.

- **Security:** Build with security as a default. [Vercel Secure
  Compute](https://vercel.com/docs/security/secure-compute){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}
  dedicates an IP address to your Vercel workloads and Vercel Firewall
  allows you to quickly block IP addresses for extra power on top of
  Vercel\'s automatic DDoS migitation.
- **Functions:**
  [Serverless](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/serverless-functions){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"} and
  [Edge
  Functions](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/edge-functions){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"} let
  you decrease cost, improve uptime, and provide instant auto-scaling to
  your frontend. When you deploy Next.js ([or any of our 40+ supported
  frameworks](https://vercel.com/docs/frameworks#list-of-supported-frameworks){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}) on
  Vercel, your developers will enjoy a completely seamless experience,
  finding the same behavior of Next.js on their local machines when
  compared to their preview and production deployments.
- **Caching:** Next.js on Vercel automatically combines the best that
  Next.js has to offer with the benefits of serverless architectures.
  Through [Framework Defined
  Infrastructure](https://vercel.com/blog/framework-defined-infrastructure){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"},
  developers are able to configure caching behavior more easily than
  ever before, including the latest innovations in frontend caching like
  Incremental Static Regeneration.
- **Observability:** First-party, built-in tooling to gain insights
  about what's going on in your frontend cloud. Query, visualize, and
  quantify the traffic to your Vercel project to find opportunities to
  optimize bandwidth, errors, and performance with [Monitoring and
  Logging](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/observability){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

## []{#strategies-for-incremental-adoption .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Strategies for incremental adoption](#strategies-for-incremental-adoption){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#strategies-for-incremental-adoption .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

To manage the risks associated with any software migration, it's a great
idea to make small, reversible changes to your system over time so [you
can quickly roll back to previous, working
versions](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/deployments/instant-rollback){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"} in
case something goes wrong. We encourage you to adopt the frontend cloud
slowly, ensuring that your confidence stays high no matter what phase of
adoption you are at.

To achieve this, we\'ll create a plan to run a combination of your
current system alongside your new Vercel frontend to get started. When
you begin, you may only have a few pages being served by Vercel, slowly
adding to your new Next.js application over time.

As we've worked with our customers over the years, we've found two
common strategies for incremental adoption.

### []{#point-your-domain-at-vercel-with-your-existing-server-as-a-fallback .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Point your domain at Vercel with your existing server as a fallback](#point-your-domain-at-vercel-with-your-existing-server-as-a-fallback){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#point-your-domain-at-vercel-with-your-existing-server-as-a-fallback .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

One approach is to make Vercel the initial entrypoint for your domain.
For application paths that have been built in your Next.js application,
Vercel will serve your newly crafted page. When a path is requested that
hasn't been built in your new application yet, your application will
seamlessly fallback to your existing server and serve a response from
there.

:::::::: {.text-block_codeWrapper__HzDMh vercel-edit-target="true"}
::::::: {.relative .code-block_wrapper__t6FCO .code-block_hasFileName__ezlBD geist-code-block=""}
:::::: code-block_header__t3NRd
:::: code-block_fileName__HmSv1
::: {.code-block_iconWrapper__TuHFk aria-hidden="true"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

[next.config.js]{.code-block_filenameP__02nok}
::::

::: code-block_actions__yphRf
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::
::::::

``` {.prism-code .language-javascript .code-block_pre___OLfy}
module.exports = {  async rewrites() {    return {      fallback: [        {          source: '/:path*',          destination: `https://my-old-site.com/:path*`,        },      ],    }  },};
```
:::::::

Setting fallback paths for any route not available in our application.
::::::::

With these rewrites in place, the original request's path, headers, and
cookies will be preserved and passed on to your existing server
solution. If you want to configure rewrites at a more granular level,
[check out the Next.js documentation on
rewrites](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/next-config-js/rewrites){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

### []{#specify-a-subpath-for-your-vercel-application .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Specify a subpath for your Vercel application](#specify-a-subpath-for-your-vercel-application){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#specify-a-subpath-for-your-vercel-application .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

As another option, you can choose to continue using your existing
resources as the main entrypoint to your application and use Vercel on a
subpath within your larger application setup.

Depending on your current system, you may need to configure a rewrite or
reverse proxy to point at Vercel. With that in place, we will need to
make sure we tell Next.js about this routing context.

Luckily, this is easy to do using [the `basePath`{.code_code__FwiyS
style="font-size:0.9em"} property in your
`next.config.js`{.code_code__FwiyS style="font-size:0.9em"}
file](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/next-config-js/basePath){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

:::::::: {.text-block_codeWrapper__HzDMh vercel-edit-target="true"}
::::::: {.relative .code-block_wrapper__t6FCO .code-block_hasFileName__ezlBD geist-code-block=""}
:::::: code-block_header__t3NRd
:::: code-block_fileName__HmSv1
::: {.code-block_iconWrapper__TuHFk aria-hidden="true"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

[next.config.js]{.code-block_filenameP__02nok}
::::

::: code-block_actions__yphRf
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::
::::::

``` {.prism-code .language-javascript .code-block_pre___OLfy}
module.exports = {  basePath: '/docs',};
```
:::::::

Setting a base path for the entire Next.js application.
::::::::

With this flag set, Next.js will be able to properly route it's requests
as a sub-path of your domain.

## []{#manage-risk-while-you're-adopting-vercel .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Manage risk while you\'re adopting Vercel](#manage-risk-while-you're-adopting-vercel){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#manage-risk-while-youre-adopting-vercel .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

You've done your homework, carefully crafted a plan, and you\'re ready
to start using Vercel\'s workflow tooling. Our tools are built to give
you confidence but, to be fully prepared for a production migration, we
need to be responsible engineers and ensure we are safely rolling out
your new technology with \"escape hatches\" for if something unexpected
happens.

### []{#using-next.js-middleware-and-vercel-edge-config .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Using Next.js Middleware and Vercel Edge Config](#using-next.js-middleware-and-vercel-edge-config){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#using-next.js-middleware-and-vercel-edge-config .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

The first strategy we recommend is to use Vercel Edge Config. With this
tool, we'll add a zero latency flag, passing all requests back to your
original server. Depending on the complexity you desire, you can build a
flexible routing architecture based on this approach through the power
of [Vercel Edge
Middleware](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/edge-middleware){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

:::::::: {.text-block_codeWrapper__HzDMh vercel-edit-target="true"}
::::::: {.relative .code-block_wrapper__t6FCO .code-block_hasFileName__ezlBD geist-code-block=""}
:::::: code-block_header__t3NRd
:::: code-block_fileName__HmSv1
::: {.code-block_iconWrapper__TuHFk aria-hidden="true"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

[middleware.ts]{.code-block_filenameP__02nok}
::::

::: code-block_actions__yphRf
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::
::::::

``` {.prism-code .language-tsx .code-block_pre___OLfy}
import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server'import { get } from '@vercel/edge-config'
export const config = {  matcher: ['/:path*'], // URL to match}
export async function middleware(req: NextRequest) {  try {    // Check whether new version should should be shown    const isNewVersionActive = await get<boolean>('isNewVersionActive')
    // If is in the new version not active we rewrite to the legacy server URL    if (!isNewVersionActive) {      req.nextUrl.pathname = `/new-path`       return NextResponse.rewrite(req.nextUrl)    }  } catch (error) {    console.error(error)  }}
```
:::::::

Using a flag to create a safety switch for the new application.
::::::::

We find that companies adopting Vercel only want to keep this flag
option around through the first few steps of their migration. Once teams
begin working in the frontend cloud, they develop confidence and new
levels of productivity quickly through the stability of their new
system. Additionally, you\'ll notice new levels of communication and
feedback, and how your new performance gains move your business metrics
since [milliseconds make
millions](https://web.dev/milliseconds-make-millions/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

### []{#using-cookies-to-serve-specific-pages-from-vercel .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Using cookies to serve specific pages from Vercel](#using-cookies-to-serve-specific-pages-from-vercel){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#using-cookies-to-serve-specific-pages-from-vercel .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Another strategy is to use use cookies to redirect traffic from your
servers to a Vercel-hosted page. This strategy is great for
incrementally introducing traffic to your Vercel application, letting
you do percentage-based and canary-based rollouts.

Depending on your current setup, the implementation for this approach
can vary in complexity. You\'ll be trading that complexity for more
granular control over how traffic is being routed for your application
and we typically only recommend this approach for customers with
high-risk requirements.

## []{#next-steps .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Next steps](#next-steps){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#next-steps .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

Through our teams of Solutions Engineers, we're prepared to partner with
you on your adoption of new tooling. We\'ve written here about the most
common patterns we\'ve seen with our customers but we're ready to help
you handle the rough edges and intricacies of your existing system so
you can breathe new life into your teams' projects.

We'll help you to build trust in your frontend cloud while continually,
incrementally ensuring you deliver more value to your users. If you
haven't already, [get in touch with one of our experts
today](https://www.notion.so/How-We-Started-Our-Rust-Porting-Effort-9897e09ab42549d28657d91956b87cce?pvs=21){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
begin your frontend cloud journey.
